intro: Kokoschkinia paniculata, commonly known as the panicled kokoschkinia, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a panicle of small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Kokoschkinia paniculata is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
